title: Lucius Tarquinius Priscus, king of Rome, celebrates a triumph for his victories over the Sabines, and the surrender of Collatia.
text: Lucius Tarquinius Priscus, king of Rome, celebrates a triumph for his victories over the Sabines, and the surrender of Collatia.

title: The Temple of Jupiter Optimus Maximus on Rome's Capitoline Hill is dedicated on the ides of September.
text: The Temple of Jupiter Optimus Maximus on Rome's Capitoline Hill is dedicated on the ides of September.

title: Yax Nuun Ahiin I is crowned as 15th Ajaw of Tikal
text: Yax Nuun Ahiin I is crowned as 15th Ajaw of Tikal

title: Belisarius of the Byzantine Empire defeats Gelimer and the Vandals at the Battle of Ad Decimum, near Carthage, North Africa.
text: Belisarius of the Byzantine Empire defeats Gelimer and the Vandals at the Battle of Ad Decimum, near Carthage, North Africa.

title: Ögedei Khan is proclaimed Khagan of the Mongol Empire in Kodoe Aral, Khentii: Mongolia.
text: Ögedei Khan is proclaimed Khagan of the Mongol Empire in Kodoe Aral, Khentii: Mongolia.

title: Battle of Tangier: a Portuguese expeditionary force initiates a failed attempt to seize the Moroccan citadel of Tangier.
text: Battle of Tangier: a Portuguese expeditionary force initiates a failed attempt to seize the Moroccan citadel of Tangier.

title: Italian Renaissance: Michelangelo begins work on his statue of David.
text: Italian Renaissance: Michelangelo begins work on his statue of David.

title: Queen Isabella and King Ferdinand issue a Royal Warrant for the construction of a Royal Chapel (Capilla Real) to be built.
text: Queen Isabella and King Ferdinand issue a Royal Warrant for the construction of a Royal Chapel (Capilla Real) to be built.

title: After three years of exile, John Calvin returns to Geneva to reform the church under a body of doctrine known as Calvinism.
text: After three years of exile, John Calvin returns to Geneva to reform the church under a body of doctrine known as Calvinism.

title: San Lorenzo del Escorial Palace in Madrid is finished.
text: San Lorenzo del Escorial Palace in Madrid is finished.

title: Henry Hudson reaches the river that would later be named after him – the Hudson River.
text: Henry Hudson reaches the river that would later be named after him – the Hudson River.

title: Battle of Philiphaugh Covenanters win the day over the royalists.
text: Battle of Philiphaugh Covenanters win the day over the royalists.

title: Great Britain, Austria and the Kingdom of Sardinia sign the Treaty of Worms.
text: Great Britain, Austria and the Kingdom of Sardinia sign the Treaty of Worms.

title: Battle of the Plains of Abraham: the British defeat the French near Quebec City in the Seven Years' War, known in the United States as the French and Indian War.
text: Battle of the Plains of Abraham: the British defeat the French near Quebec City in the Seven Years' War, known in the United States as the French and Indian War.

title: American Revolutionary War: Franco-Spanish troops launch the unsuccessful "grand assault" during the Great Siege of Gibraltar.
text: American Revolutionary War: Franco-Spanish troops launch the unsuccessful "grand assault" during the Great Siege of Gibraltar.

title: The Philadelphia Convention sets the date for the first presidential election in the United States, and New York City becomes the country's temporary capital.
text: The Philadelphia Convention sets the date for the first presidential election in the United States, and New York City becomes the country's temporary capital.

title: King Louis XVI of France accepts the new constitution.
text: King Louis XVI of France accepts the new constitution.

title: Finnish War: In the Battle of Jutas, Swedish forces under Lieutenant General Georg Carl von Döbeln beat the Russians, making von Döbeln a Swedish war hero.
text: Finnish War: In the Battle of Jutas, Swedish forces under Lieutenant General Georg Carl von Döbeln beat the Russians, making von Döbeln a Swedish war hero.

title: War of 1812: A supply wagon sent to relieve Fort Harrison is ambushed in the Attack at the Narrows.
text: War of 1812: A supply wagon sent to relieve Fort Harrison is ambushed in the Attack at the Narrows.

title: In a turning point in the War of 1812, the British fail to capture Baltimore. During the battle, Francis Scott Key composes his poem "Defence of Fort McHenry", which is later set to music and becomes the United States' national anthem.
text: In a turning point in the War of 1812, the British fail to capture Baltimore. During the battle, Francis Scott Key composes his poem "Defence of Fort McHenry", which is later set to music and becomes the United States' national anthem.

title: The Greek Army rebels (OS date: September 3) against the autocratic rule of king Otto of Greece, demanding the granting of a constitution.
text: The Greek Army rebels (OS date: September 3) against the autocratic rule of king Otto of Greece, demanding the granting of a constitution.

title: Mexican–American War: Six teenage military cadets known as Niños Héroes die defending Chapultepec Castle in the Battle of Chapultepec. American troops under General Winfield Scott capture Mexico City in the Mexican–American War.
text: Mexican–American War: Six teenage military cadets known as Niños Héroes die defending Chapultepec Castle in the Battle of Chapultepec. American troops under General Winfield Scott capture Mexico City in the Mexican–American War.

title: Vermont railroad worker Phineas Gage survives an iron rod 1 1⁄4 inches (3.2 cm) in diameter being driven through his brain; the reported effects on his behavior and personality stimulate thinking about the nature of the brain and its functions.
text: Vermont railroad worker Phineas Gage survives an iron rod 1 1⁄4 inches (3.2 cm) in diameter being driven through his brain; the reported effects on his behavior and personality stimulate thinking about the nature of the brain and its functions.

title: American Civil War: Union soldiers find a copy of Robert E. Lee's battle plans in a field outside Frederick, Maryland. It is the prelude to the Battle of Antietam.
text: American Civil War: Union soldiers find a copy of Robert E. Lee's battle plans in a field outside Frederick, Maryland. It is the prelude to the Battle of Antietam.

title: Anglo-Egyptian War: The Battle of Tel el-Kebir is fought.
text: Anglo-Egyptian War: The Battle of Tel el-Kebir is fought.

title: Hannibal Goodwin patents celluloid photographic film.
text: Hannibal Goodwin patents celluloid photographic film.

title: Henry Bliss is the first person in the United States to be killed in an automobile accident.
text: Henry Bliss is the first person in the United States to be killed in an automobile accident.

title: Mackinder, Ollier and Brocherel make the first ascent of Batian (5,199 m – 17,058 ft), the highest peak of Mount Kenya.
text: Mackinder, Ollier and Brocherel make the first ascent of Batian (5,199 m – 17,058 ft), the highest peak of Mount Kenya.

title: Filipino resistance fighters defeat a small American column in the Battle of Pulang Lupa, during the Philippine–American War.
text: Filipino resistance fighters defeat a small American column in the Battle of Pulang Lupa, during the Philippine–American War.

title: First flight of a fixed-wing aircraft in Europe.
text: First flight of a fixed-wing aircraft in Europe.

title: World War I: South African troops open hostilities in German south-west Africa (Namibia) with an assault on the Ramansdrift police station.
text: World War I: South African troops open hostilities in German south-west Africa (Namibia) with an assault on the Ramansdrift police station.

title: World War I: The Battle of Aisne begins between Germany and France.
text: World War I: The Battle of Aisne begins between Germany and France.

title: The final act of the Greco-Turkish War, the Great Fire of Smyrna, commences.
text: The final act of the Greco-Turkish War, the Great Fire of Smyrna, commences.

title: Following a military coup in Spain, Miguel Primo de Rivera takes over, setting up a dictatorship.
text: Following a military coup in Spain, Miguel Primo de Rivera takes over, setting up a dictatorship.

title: Elizabeth McCombs becomes the first woman elected to the New Zealand Parliament.
text: Elizabeth McCombs becomes the first woman elected to the New Zealand Parliament.

title: Rockslide near Whirlpool Rapids Bridge ends the International Railway (New York–Ontario).
text: Rockslide near Whirlpool Rapids Bridge ends the International Railway (New York–Ontario).

title: World War II: Second day of the Battle of Edson's Ridge in the Guadalcanal Campaign. U.S. Marines successfully defeated attacks by the Imperial Japanese Army with heavy losses for the Japanese forces.
text: World War II: Second day of the Battle of Edson's Ridge in the Guadalcanal Campaign. U.S. Marines successfully defeated attacks by the Imperial Japanese Army with heavy losses for the Japanese forces.

title: Deputy Prime Minister of India Vallabhbhai Patel orders the Army to move into Hyderabad to integrate it with the Indian Union.
text: Deputy Prime Minister of India Vallabhbhai Patel orders the Army to move into Hyderabad to integrate it with the Indian Union.

title: Margaret Chase Smith is elected United States senator, and becomes the first woman to serve in both the U.S. House of Representatives and the United States Senate.
text: Margaret Chase Smith is elected United States senator, and becomes the first woman to serve in both the U.S. House of Representatives and the United States Senate.

title: Nikita Khrushchev is appointed General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.
text: Nikita Khrushchev is appointed General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.

title: The dike around the Dutch polder East Flevoland is closed.
text: The dike around the Dutch polder East Flevoland is closed.

title: The IBM 305 RAMAC is introduced, the first commercial computer to use disk storage.
text: The IBM 305 RAMAC is introduced, the first commercial computer to use disk storage.

title: An appeals court orders the University of Mississippi to admit James Meredith the first African-American student admitted to the segregated University of Mississippi,
text: An appeals court orders the University of Mississippi to admit James Meredith the first African-American student admitted to the segregated University of Mississippi,

title: South Vietnamese Generals Lâm Văn Phát and Dương Văn Đức fail in a coup attempt against General Nguyễn Khánh.
text: South Vietnamese Generals Lâm Văn Phát and Dương Văn Đức fail in a coup attempt against General Nguyễn Khánh.

title: Cold War: Albania leaves the Warsaw Pact.
text: Cold War: Albania leaves the Warsaw Pact.

title: State police and National Guardsmen storm New York's Attica Prison to quell a prison revolt.
text: State police and National Guardsmen storm New York's Attica Prison to quell a prison revolt.

title: Chairman Mao Zedong's second in command and successor Marshal Lin Biao flees the People's Republic of China after the failure of an alleged coup. His plane crashes in Mongolia, killing all aboard.
text: Chairman Mao Zedong's second in command and successor Marshal Lin Biao flees the People's Republic of China after the failure of an alleged coup. His plane crashes in Mongolia, killing all aboard.

title: South Africa grants independence to the "homeland" of Venda (not recognised outside South Africa).
text: South Africa grants independence to the "homeland" of Venda (not recognised outside South Africa).

title: Super Mario Bros. is released in Japan for the NES, which starts the Super Mario series of platforming games.
text: Super Mario Bros. is released in Japan for the NES, which starts the Super Mario series of platforming games.

title: Goiânia accident: A radioactive object is stolen from an abandoned hospital in Goiânia, Brazil, contaminating many people in the following weeks and causing some to die from radiation poisoning.
text: Goiânia accident: A radioactive object is stolen from an abandoned hospital in Goiânia, Brazil, contaminating many people in the following weeks and causing some to die from radiation poisoning.

title: Hurricane Gilbert is the strongest recorded hurricane in the Western Hemisphere, later replaced by Hurricane Wilma in 2005 (based on barometric pressure).
text: Hurricane Gilbert is the strongest recorded hurricane in the Western Hemisphere, later replaced by Hurricane Wilma in 2005 (based on barometric pressure).

title: Largest anti-Apartheid march in South Africa, led by Desmond Tutu.
text: Largest anti-Apartheid march in South Africa, led by Desmond Tutu.

title: Israeli Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin shakes hands with Palestine Liberation Organization chairman Yasser Arafat at the White House after signing the Oslo Accords granting limited Palestinian autonomy.

title: Civilian aircraft traffic resumes in the United States after the September 11 attacks.

title: The Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples is adopted by the United Nations General Assembly.
